messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance on Zoning Regulations
- Summary: The council discussed and voted on an ordinance related to zoning regulations, with a focus on commercial and residential zoning in specific districts.
- Ordinance Number: 2ca12938-fd9c-4d0b-b8ae-cb65783db2cb
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments, impacting zoning regulations in specific districts.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning regulations, Commercial zoning, Residential zoning
- UID: 2ca12938-fd9c-4d0b-b8ae-cb65783db2cb

- Topic: Approval of the Minutes - July 7, 2022 and July 21, 2022
- Summary: The minutes from the specified dates were approved.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approval of the minutes from July 7, 2022 and July 21, 2022.

- UID: 7e3c1c8a-53cf-4e02-a50b-ea3c363e021f

- Summary: Dr. Avis Williams presented her entry plan/strategy to the New Orleans City Council.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Presentation by the Superintendent of NOLA Public Schools.

- Topic: Honoring Tank and the Bangas
- Summary: The City Council honored New Orleans' Grammy-nominated band, Tank and the Bangas.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The band was honored for their achievements.
- Tags/Keywords: Music, Honoring, Tank and the Bangas

- Topic: Lincoln Beach Community Advisory Committee Update
- Summary: The Advisory Committee members updated the City Council on progress made to beautify and maintain historic Lincoln Beach.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The Committee provided an update on their efforts.
- Tags/Keywords: Lincoln Beach, Community Advisory Committee, Beautification
- UID: e208a65a-dd70-43a1-be37-a9422aa22bf3

- Topic: Amendment to Surveillance Technologies Use
- Summary: An ordinance to amend and reordain Section 147-2 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, providing new precautions and required data collection for the use of surveillance technologies, with specific limitations on facial recognition technology.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,809
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a requirement for judicial approval of facial recognition technology and monthly reporting on its use.
- Tags/Keywords: Surveillance Technologies, Facial Recognition, Data Collection
- UID: e208a65a-dd70-43a1-be37-a9422aa22bf3

- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 30/22 — CITY COUNCIL MOTION NO. M-22-111
- Summary: The ordinance requests an amendment to the text of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to incorporate Phase 1 proposals outlined by the City Planning Commission staff in its Outdoor Live Entertainment Study. This includes expanding the allowed number of temporary outdoor entertainment events, expanding the zoning districts for outdoor amphitheaters, and clarifying and revising use standards for live entertainment.
- Ordinance Number: 84412290-3e81-4d09-9a03-849a55bf7de0
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Outdoor Live Entertainment, City Planning Commission
- UID: 84412290-3e81-4d09-9a03-849a55bf7de0

- Topic: Text Amendment Request for Live Entertainment and Ancillary Uses
- Summary: The ordinance proposed text amendments related to live entertainment, including allowing entertainment on private property, changing use standards for Public Markets, and expanding live entertainment within Arts & Cultural Overlay Districts. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "NO LEGAL MAJORITY".
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO _ 30-22
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (4 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 3 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The text amendment request was approved with modifications.
- Tags/Keywords: Live entertainment, Text amendment, City Planning Commission, Zoning District
- UID: 7cad5d8a-1759-42ff-b258-4d5011cdc941

- Topic: Amendment to Motion M-22-343
- Summary: The amendment proposed modifications to Table 10-1: Permitted and Conditional Uses related to the text amendment request for live entertainment. The amendment was adopted, and the motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-343
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to the motion was adopted, and the motion passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Text amendment, Permitted and Conditional Uses, Motion amendment
- UID: 7cad5d8a-1759-42ff-b258-4d5011cdc941

- Topic: Amendment to Motion M-22-343
- Summary: The amendment proposed changes to the heading and the definition of Outdoor Live Entertainment — Secondary Use.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-343
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was adopted with 7 yeas, 2 nays, 1 abstain, and 1 absent.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Motion, Outdoor Live Entertainment, Definition
- UID: 5ab2582e-b151-4d61-ad19-4428a408bd61

- Topic: Amendment to outdoor live entertainment regulations
- Summary: The amendment aims to regulate outdoor live entertainment activities, limiting the number of days per week for such events and specifying restrictions in the Vieux Carré Districts. It also outlines activities permitted within an enclosed structure and temporary uses.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment passed with a majority vote, establishing new regulations for outdoor live entertainment and temporary uses.
- Tags/Keywords: Outdoor live entertainment, Temporary uses, Amendment
- UID: b2458696-7274-433f-9432-fcc3b787cc4b

- Topic: Temporary Outdoor Entertainment Events (Ordinance 12/3/23)
- Summary: The ordinance allows for temporary outdoor entertainment events on public or private property under specific conditions, including a maximum of three consecutive days per special event and a maximum of eight special events per calendar year. A management plan is required for review, and specific standards apply to this temporary use.
- Ordinance Number: 12/3/23
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, allowing for temporary outdoor entertainment events under specified conditions.
- UID: 55198c4e-5a5a-493f-9af2-abf6f98e4f7b

- Topic: Approval of applicant's text amendment request with modifications on ZD NO. 30/22
- Summary: The council approved the applicant's text amendment request with modifications on ZD NO. 30/22.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-343
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approval of the applicant's text amendment request with modifications on ZD NO. 30/22
- UID: 8210e015-c706-47dd-b695-b6ad294fc612

- Topic: Amendment to Section 2-62 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to require Public Safety Agencies to submit raw data in machine-readable format to the City Council on a monthly basis. The ordinance was electronically submitted, and it passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,818
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Public Safety, Data Submission, Code Amendment
- UID: 32c18108-ae4c-4c24-b058-b0ca5237ca92

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance No. 28,863 M.C.S.
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend an operating budget of expenditures for the City of New Orleans. The ordinance passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,817
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Amendment, Expenditures, City Budget
- UID: 32c18108-ae4c-4c24-b058-b0ca5237ca92

- Topic: Appropriation of Federal funds for Radiological and Nuclear detection equipment
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate Federal funds awarded by the Department of Homeland Security to New Orleans Homeland Security for the purchase of Radiological and Nuclear detection equipment and salaries for grant employees. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 8/18/22 and referred to the Budget Committee.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 8/18/22 and referred to the Budget Committee
- Tags/Keywords: Federal funds, Homeland Security, Radiological and Nuclear detection equipment, Budget Committee
- UID: 5bdeb7d5-f947-4f58-9f00-734d2fa52662

- Topic: Recovery of remains of the victims of the UpStairs Lounge fire
- Summary: This motion directs the Department of Property Management and the Law Department to provide legal access to the City-owned cemetery adjacent to Resthaven and offer assistance in recovering the remains of the victims of the UpStairs Lounge fire interred on City property. The motion was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-350
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion was adopted
- Tags/Keywords: UpStairs Lounge fire, City-owned cemetery, Department of Property Management, Law Department
- UID: 5bdeb7d5-f947-4f58-9f00-734d2fa52662

- Topic: Creation of new civilian positions and analysis of current NOPD civilian positions
- Summary: This motion directs the Civil Service Department to conduct expeditious work studies to create new civilian positions determined necessary by the NOPD and to analyze current NOPD civilian positions for pay levels and potential pay increases. The motion was electronically submitted and is pending further action.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-352
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Electronically submitted, pending further action
- Tags/Keywords: Civil Service Department, NOPD civilian positions, work studies, pay levels
- UID: 5bdeb7d5-f947-4f58-9f00-734d2fa52662

- Topic: Appointment of Dalton Savwoir to Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force
- Summary: Councilmember Green introduced the motion to ratify, confirm, and approve the appointment of Dalton Savwoir as a member of the Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force, effective until August 4, 2023. The motion was electronically submitted and recommended for approval by the Governmental Affairs Committee. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-355
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget for 2022

- Topic: Travel Policies for Elected Officials and City Employees
- Summary: This ordinance required the creation and publication of policies for essential and nonessential travel by elected officials and City employees. It mandated that transportation and lodging for City-approved travel be made available within 72 business hours and all receipts be submitted within 14 business days of completing travel.
- Ordinance Number: 33,835
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed unanimously, establishing new travel policies for City officials and employees.
- UID: faaeecf7-1918-4f3b-9bb4-544c9143c9a3
